columns.text: In this exercise, we are going to learn about Black Scholes Model.

To start with, let us define  Black Scholes Model. 

**Black Scholes Model** is a mathematical equation that involves probabilities to compute the price of an option. 

The equation of the Black Scholes Model is illustrated as follows: 

$$\textbf{C}=\text{S}\times\text{N}_{\text{(d1})}-\text{X}\times\text{e}^{\text{-rt}}\times\text{N}_{\text{(d2)}}$$

Where: 

- C- Call Option
- S- Stock Price
- X - Exercise Price
- r - rate
- t - time
- N(d1) - Probability if z is less than or equal to d1
- N(d2) - Probability if z is less than or equal to d2

Whereas d1 is solved as follows: 

$$\textbf{d}_{1}=\frac{\left[\text{ln}\frac{\text{S}}{\text{X}}\right]+\left(\text{r}+\frac{σ^2}{2}\right)\times\text{t}}{\left(σ\times\sqrt{\text{t}}\right)}$$

And d2's equation is illustrated below: 

$$\textbf{d}_{2}=\text{d}_{1}-σ\times\sqrt{\text{t}}$$

Where: 

- σ - Standard deviation
- ln - natural logarithm

Here are the parameters to solve the problem : 


|Given | | 
|--|--| 
| Stock price (S) |$75 | 
| Exercise price (X) |0 | 
|Risk-free rate (r) | 4% | 
|Time (t) |6 months; 6/12; 0.50 | 
|Standard deviation(σ) | 20% per year| 
| e| 2.71828|

To start with, let us solve the natural logarithm of the quotient of the current stock price and the exercise price. 

We are going to use excel to solve the natural logarithm. The formula should look as follows: 



!['slader'](https://slader-solution-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/538c2554-02e3-4874-be3d-d2dfeeb0d65f-1661689495439786.png)

Thus, LN(S/X) is 0.

Next, let us solve d1 using the equation in Step 3: 


 
$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{d}_{1}&=\frac{0+\left[0.04+\frac{0.20^2}{2}\right]\times0.50}{0.20\sqrt{0.50}}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0+\left[0.04+\frac{0.04}{2}\right]\times0.50}{0.20\times0.7071}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0+\left[0.04+0.02\right]\times0.50}{0.1414}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0+(0.06\times0.50)}{0.1414}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0+0.03}{0.1414}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.03}{0.1414}\\[20pt]
&=0.2122\space\text{or}\space0.21 \space\text{when rounded}
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, d1 is 0.21.

Now, here are the values of N(d1) and N(d2) using the cumulative normal distribution table: 


|Normal distribution | | 
|--|--| 
|Nd1 |0.5832 | 
|Nd2 |0.5279 |

The Nd1 becomes infinity when substituted on the call option equation. Using the equation in Step 2, the value of the call option is solved below: 

 

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{C}&=(\$75\times1)-0\times2.71828^{-(0.04)(0.50)}\times0.5279\\[15pt]
&=(\$75\times1)-0\times2.71828^{-(0.02)}\times0.5279\\[15pt]
&=(\$75\times1)-0\times0.98\times0.5279\\[15pt]
&=\$75\times1-0\times0.5173\\[15pt]
&=\$75\times1-0\\[15pt]
&=\boxed{\$75}
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, the value of the call option is $75.
